ItemTooltips.quelling_blade: Last-Hitting should be a cinch with Quelling Blade.
ItemTooltips.ring_of_health: An early ring of Health to build towards Battle Fury and to avoid harassment in the lane as he farms his initial items.
ItemTooltips.poor_mans_shield: Pick this up if you are having trouble in the early-game.
ItemTooltips.heart: Survivability is all that Anti-Mage needs now to deal his Mana Break and ultimately tear the enemy team down.
ItemTooltips.black_king_bar: After Manta Style, Black King Bar is your last item given it lets you consistently deal mana burn and damage to the enemy without being interrupted.
ItemTooltips.manta: Manta Style works alongside your passive ability: Mana Break, dealing more damage and sapping their mana faster.
ItemTooltips.abyssal_blade: Consider Basher and Abyssal Blade to keep rivaling physical carries down and you high on your damage as your agility is sufficient.
ItemTooltips.tranquil_boots:
If you just can't seem to survive in the lane, pick these up.
Later, disassemble them to make Vladmir's Offering.

AbilityTooltips.antimage_mana_break: Tear down initiators and magic-damage dealers with Mana Break. Anti-Mage literally destroys foes quickly via Manta Style and Battle Fury!
AbilityTooltips.antimage_blink: Be sure to use Blink to escape or engage opponents.
AbilityTooltips.antimage_spell_shield: One level in resist if you're getting ganked often by spellcasters and disablers. Pick this up early as an emergency.
AbilityTooltips.antimage_mana_void:
After extensively hitting your opponent, follow-up with your ultimate to do extensive damage. It has a decently-sized AOE, so choose wisely!

Mana Void also does a ministun, so be sure to use it to disrupt channeling spells or teleport scrolls.
